parameters: Thank you all for joining me. Tali, how is
Elim holding up do you know? I've checked in
on him, but he's been resting most of the
As well as can be expected considering...
The healers have said that his other eye is
healthy, so his vision should be ok in time.
In our land, those who lose their sight in
combat are given retired positions of honour.
Most of us are archers, and it's hard to
You've known Elim for a while now Feylora, so
you tell me - do you think he is going to
allow himself to be sidelined while this battle
I think he could possibly kill you where you
stand should you even suggest such a thing.
Yes, I know you are wondering about what
happened. I've been considering what I know
about the Sword, but i'm still uncertain how
Sargon is so freely coming and going.
The only clue that we seem to have is that
direct members of his bloodline seem to be
vulnerable to possession or exchange of some
sort. As we observed with the Queen...
Tali look - we have discussed this at great
length already. Given everything that we know,
and everything that has happened, you made the
correct choice. Victoria would not want to be
made into a puppet or a slave. I will grieve
for her properly when the time allows. For now,
do not burden yourself with this. I hold no
ill will towards you for your actions.
Feylora, since we've been catching up during
Elim's recuperation, my agents have been
looking into the Sceptre that you described.
It seems as if some sort of warband is
gathering near Garras, the capital of Durast
to the far west of here. Their leader is said
to be carrying a sceptre with a golden light.
That has to be it! We must go there. In fact,
it makes sense to go there. Remember the
Necromancer exiles I mentioned before Tali?
Yes, you'd said that they had taken up
residence in Garras. Feylora's right Alex,
that has to be our next move.
Indeed I am compelled to agree. I know not
how Sargon is slipping through the bonds of
the sword, but this seems like a good way to
get to the heart of the problem.
And if there is any chance to get Odan back,
we will leave no stone unturned in doing so.
It gladdens me to see you up and about Elim.
I'm ready to get back to the hunt, Alex. The
Elim, I know that we haven't had much time to
talk, but I know that this has become personal
for you. It is for me too. I hope we can work
together to put an end to this crisis.
Absolutely - but lets get one thing straight.
We will be using the Wyrmforged shard to
destroy Sargon - Malphas can rot inside the
sword for all eternity for all I care.
What? That's not what the shard was designed
for! Are you so petty that you will allow your
vendetta against one man to undo centuries of
That "one man" has clearly been orchestrating
events for centuries behind the scenes. He
even seems to have more power than Malphas!
At least when the sword is locked away it is
of no threat to anyone else. Sargon will be
a threat to the kingdom so long as he remains
But the destruction of Malphas will do more
to safeguard the kingdom than anything else!
There will be enough vengance to go round for
everyone - right now, I suggest that we
concentrate on other matters. We have forces
here, and from Willowbend ready to march
against Sargon when the time comes. I have
received correspondance back from Osgoth to
the north, and they will also support us. We
have not heard back from Durast though - it is
unclear if this gathering band is disrupting
their communications. Either way, it sounds
like that is the next place to go.
The necromancer exiles will be able to help us,
Elim, I promise you that I want revenge for
Odan as well. But all of this is too big to
ignore - let's do what we can at Garras, then
we can plot our next moves.
Rahab has prepared the Dauntless to take us
to the Clockwork Docks, the port nearest
Durast's capital, Garras. The bridge over the
Aetherflow is still being repaired, so that's
the only route over there at the moment.
If one of Sargon's henchmen is wielding a
soul shard, they will be formidable to defeat.
We? Surely you don't mean to join us Alex?
Elim, we've already lost Odan. We can't afford
to lose you as well. There's no further
preparations I can make here anyway. I can
lend my magic to the cause. And like you and
Tali, my interest in this has become personal
as well. Sargon will answer for what he has
done - but only after we make the Kingdom
It's personal for us all now. Between Malphas
and Sargon, its fair to say we all have a
Lead the way then your majesty.
I think not, Elim. As much as my magic will
help you, I'm not the tried and tested battle
commander you are. Besides, this is your unit,
I am happy to serve the realm on this quest.
The trading post has beeen restocked with
new equipment. We should go there first before

parameters.newDescription: 1) Talk to King Alexander in the Throne Room\n2)Take the Dauntless from Altair Docks to Durast

parameters: New Description = 1) Talk to King Alexander in the Throne R…
THIS PART IS WHERE THE SWITCH COMMAND IS TOGGLED IN THE
Vaeraxis has joined the party. He has the special ability
of Adaptation. Vaeraxis can equip any armour type with the
exception of Large Shields, and Heavy Armour. Additionally,
Vaeraxis will always get the maximum number of abilities
from a Soul Shard he has equipped, no matter which Soul
Alex has joined the party. As a Voidweaver, he offers
both offensive and support spells. In addition, he regains
magic points automatically every round, and has a slight
Elim's prowess in battle has improved. His attacks now
have an improved chance to deal a critical hit. You can
review this attribute in the Status menu.
Tali has gained the Pharmacology ability. This means that
when she uses items which either heal allies, or damage
opponents, she will deal more damage or heal more HP than
other allies using those same items.
Feylora has improved her agilty. Every round in combat,
there is a small chance that she will be able to act
immediately again after she has taken her first action.
The party has gained access to both the Formation menu and
the Switch command in battle. The formation menu allows you
to select which members of the party you wish to bring into
battle. Elim is the party leader, and cannot be changed
manually. You may have a maximum of 4 members of the party
in combat at any one time.
The switch command now appears in the battle menu. This
allows the currently active party member to swap places
with an ally who is currently out of the battle.
